title: Comment on "Supersymmetry and Singular Potentials" by Das and Pernice [Nucl. Phys. B 561 (1999) 357]
abstract: Witten's supersymmetric quantum mechanics may incorporate potentials with strong singularities after their appropriate regularization. This was proposed by Das and Pernice [Nucl. Phys. B 561 (1999) 357 and arXiv: hep-th/0207112]. We suggest that one of the most natural recipes of this type is generated by an infinitesimal complex shift of coordinates. The necessary regularization is then mediated by a non-Hermitian, PT symmetric intermediate Hamiltonian.
